p: Adjustment of associations (and often a full order of magnitude) is needed in medicine when new data appear. The past should warn us that we may merge too many connections in a convenient causative chain with diagnoses that are incorrect, overestimated, or underestimated. Time (and scientific scrutiny) will tell if neurointensivists can be useful “on the frontlines” [ 23] or will be left waiting for what is to come, without knowing what “it” is, or even finding out that “it” never occurred. If any, this new pandemic will teach us something and perhaps more than something.
